bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HIGGINS:H.R. 2177.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitution authority of this legislation lies in thepower of congress to regulate commercial activity asdescribed in Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3. With furthersupport from Article 1, Section 8, Clause 4.[Page H4187]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Passport Acquisition Savings and Security Act of 2011 or the PASS Act of 2011 - Provides for the payment of passport fees directly to the Department of State rather than to the U.S. Treasury.

Expresses the sense of Congress that new revenues directed to the Department should be used to reduce passport costs for consumers.

bill.title: Passport Acquisition Savings and Security Act of 2011

item.title: Passport Acquisition Savings and Security Act of 2011
Passport Acquisition Savings and Security Act of 2011
To direct the payment of passport fees to the Department of State.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
